snippet: An Egyptian judge sentenced nine men convicted of sexual assault to terms of 20 years to life after the government pledged to severely punish violence against women.
abstract: Egyptian judge sentences nine men accused of sexual assault to terms of 20 years to life; lengthy penalties come after Egypt's government pledged that sexual violence against women would be more severely punished; men faced charges in four attacks, including at a mass celebration after the election of Egypt’s new president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, in Tahrir Square.
lead_paragraph: An Egyptian judge sentenced nine men convicted of sexual assault to terms of 20 years to life after the government pledged to severely punish violence against women.

headline.main: Nine in Egypt Are Convicted in Sex Assaults
headline.print_headline: Nine in Egypt Are Convicted in Sex Assaults
